items.title: Native Clock
items.description: A clock app that I developed in my pursuit of understanding the Windows API. Starting from the Win32 paradigms, to adding modern features using modern APIs, I designed the clock to reflect the desktop wallpaper, similar to the Mica effect in Windows 11.

items.title: Bokksumeka
items.description:
Semester Project for Experimental Games. Our project revolved around controlling a dog mech in the game using large-scale custom hardware. In my contribution, Sliders, Switches, and Buttons connected to an Arduino sent inputs to the Unity Engine. The code I wrote for the Arduino involved bitwise programming that reflected a custom input device that I coded in the Unity Input System.
https://github.com/xXLordXx-CoolDood/Experimental_Game_Entaglement

items.title: Smoke & Mirrors
items.description:
Semester Project for Ludic Games. For our first semester project, we made a simple puzzle game where the player used a combination of lights, the color of which revealed corresponding objects. On my part, I made the lights interact with each other using recursive raycasts, as well as mirrors to reflect the lights. The challenge was having lights meet at different angles combining into a new light source that shined along the normal, which I figured out using recursive raycasts.
https://github.com/RastaMoses/SmokeAndMirrors

items.title: Beatdown
items.description:
Semester Project for Multiplayer Games. This project was a couch co-op rhythm based shooter, where different weapons were synchronized with different parts of the music. It was our first dive into using FMOD, which was a massive help in designing the weapons system. Aside from this, I worked on the character movement, where the character was on rollerblades, increasing their speed if the player pressed to the beat.
https://github.com/ahsan2649/BA3-Musik-Spiel

items.title: Lost Adrift
items.description:
Semester Project for Narrative Games. The aim of this project was to design around a narrative. As such, the gameplay elements were simple. My work here was minor - adding outlines to selectable objects, and raycasting to detect object proximity.
https://github.com/ahsan2649/Lost-Adrift

items.title: Portfolio 1.0
items.description: This website was made with Angular. I made modular nested components to facilitate state management, and a custom pipe to filter through all of the items by category.
